lead_paragraph: Gunmen killed the lawmaker, Aden Madeer, as he left a mosque in Mogadishu. He was the fifth member of Somalia’s Parliament to be killed by insurgents this year.
abstract: Gunmen kill Somali lawmaker Aden Madeer as he leaves mosque in Mogadishu; he is fifth member of Somalia’s Parliament to be killed by insurgents in 2014; militant Islamist group Shabab claims responsibility.

snippet: Captors freed Michael Scott Moore, a German-American kidnapped while researching piracy, after a ransom was paid, The Associated Press reported.
lead_paragraph: Captors freed Michael Scott Moore, a German-American kidnapped while researching piracy, after a ransom was paid, The Associated Press reported.
abstract: German-American journalist Michael Scott Moore is freed by Somalian pirates after more than two years of captivity; pirate commander tells journalist that Moore was released after a ransom was paid.

headline.main: Journalist Kidnapped in Somalia Is Released
headline.print_headline: Germany: German-American Is Freed by Pirates in Somalia

headline.print_headline: Somalia: Pirates Fight Over Cash

snippet: The three men were arrested upon their return to Germany after receiving training and then fighting alongside militants from the group known as the Shabab.
lead_paragraph: The three men were arrested upon their return to Germany after receiving training and then fighting alongside militants from the group known as the Shabab.
abstract: German authorities say they arrested three Germans at Frankfurt Airport who are suspected of training and fighting with Somali Islamist group known as the Shabab.

headline.main: Germany Arrests 3 on Charges of Joining Somali Militants
headline.print_headline: Germany: 3 Detained Over Ties to Somali Militants

snippet: Somali and American officials said Tuesday that the leader of the Shabab, the Somali militant group that has allied itself with Al Qaeda, may have been killed.
lead_paragraph: Somali and American officials said Tuesday that the leader of the Shabab, the Somali militant group that has allied itself with Al Qaeda, may have been killed.
abstract: Somalia and American officials say that Ahmed Abdi Godane, leader of Shabab, Somali militant group that has allied itself with Al Qaeda, may have been killed in American airstrikes; Godane has been one of the most wanted figures in Africa, widely believed to have orchestrated countless attacks on civilians, including 2013 massacre of dozens of shoppers at mall in Nariobi.

headline.print_headline: Airstrike in Somalia by U.S. Forces Targets Shabab Leader

lead_paragraph: At least 12 people were killed and more than 27 were wounded when suicide bombers attacked a convoy carrying African Union troops and Somali officials, officials and witnesses said.
abstract: At least 12 people are killed and more than 27 are wounded in Somalia when suicide bombers attack convoy carrying African Union troops and Somali officials south of Mogadishu; militant group Shabab claims responsibility.

headline.print_headline: Somalia: Rebels Kill at Least 12 in Attack on Convoy

snippet: The intertwined journeys of two friends toward militancy offer a sharp example of how the allure of Islamist extremism has evolved, enticing similar pools of young Americans to conflicts in different parts of the world.
lead_paragraph: The intertwined journeys of two friends toward militancy offer a sharp example of how the allure of Islamist extremism has evolved, enticing similar pools of young Americans to conflicts in different parts of the world.
abstract: Intertwined journeys of Troy Kastigar and Douglas McAuthur McCain, Minnesota men who died after joining Islamic militants, offer sharp example of how allure of Islamist extremism has evolved; tools of online propaganda and shadowy networks of facilitators are now drawing hundreds of Europeans and about dozen known Americans to fight with Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

headline.main: For Jihad Recruits, a Pipeline From Minnesota to Militancy
headline.print_headline: For Jihad Recruits, a Pipeline From Minnesota to Militancy

snippet: The Shabab, the Qaeda-linked militant network in Somalia, confirmed that its leader, Ahmed Abdi Godane, had been killed in an American airstrike.
lead_paragraph: The Shabab, the Qaeda-linked militant network in Somalia, confirmed that its leader, Ahmed Abdi Godane, had been killed in an American airstrike.
abstract: Shabab, Qaeda-linked militant network in Somalia, confirms that its leader Ahmed Abdi Godane has been killed in an American airstrike, and identifies its new leader as Sheikh Ahmad Umar Abu Ubaidah.

abstract: Somali government troops raid house in Mogadishu belonging to former warlord Ahmed Daci as part of a disarmament campaign, setting off clash that leaves at least seven people dead.

snippet: A lawsuit claims that an expanded national security screening targeting Muslims uses overly broad criteria and has tied up naturalization and green card applications filed by Palestinian, Iranian and Somali applicants.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit claims that an expanded national security screening targeting Muslims uses overly broad criteria and has tied up naturalization and green card applications filed by Palestinian, Iranian and Somali applicants.
abstract: Five people file lawsuit against federal government, claiming that expanded national security screening targeting Muslims has led to lengthy delays and denials in their citizenship and green card applications.

headline.print_headline: Suit Claims Security Screening Delays Immigration Applications for Muslims

snippet: Nearly one-fourth of the population of Utica, N.Y., are refugee families, who have become an economic engine for the slumping industrial city.
lead_paragraph: Nearly one-fourth of the population of Utica, N.Y., are refugee families, who have become an economic engine for the slumping industrial city.
abstract: As much as one-fourth of population of Utica, NY, is made up of refugee families, and immigrant population has become economic engine for the city; latest influx of refugees consists primarily of Somali Bantus, who have had tougher time adapting to the city than previous ethnic groups.

headline.main: A New Life for Refugees, and the City They Adopted
headline.print_headline: A New Life for Refugees, and the City They Adopted

snippet: The United Nations said that aid groups were unable to feed the more than 350,000 people in need in the capital, warning of “alarming malnutrition rates.”
lead_paragraph: The United Nations said that aid groups were unable to feed the more than 350,000 people in need in the capital, warning of “alarming malnutrition rates.”
abstract: United Nations warns that more than 350,000 people in Mogadishu, Somalia, are in acute need of food aid, and blames funding shortages and a volatile security situation that has at times restricted delivery of food into refugee settlements.

abstract: Gunmen kill female Somali lawmaker Saado Ali Warsame in drive-by shooting in capital Mogadishu, fourth killing of a Somali lawmaker in 2014.

headline.print_headline: Somalia: Militants Kill Lawmaker
